reviews.text: The Tijuana Marriott charged only $90 per night. It must have been more expensive before. But with Tijuana a killing ground for the drug cartels, tourism has fallen and so has foreign business investment. Hence the low price.
reviews.title: Good price, and there's a reason for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers plenty of security and offers everything else that you'd expect at a Marriott. The views from the room are not pretty, though.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.

reviews.text: What a nice surprise. Really was not expecting much from my past experiences in Tijuana, but I must say it certainly felt like a resort NOT in Tijuana. Highly recommend the hotel. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast buffet was excellent.
reviews.title: Just perfect!!

reviews.text: this marriott offers an excellent and friendly service from the start, the front desk staff is super nice, they were able to provide me with the room that I specifically ask for wich was incredibly comfortable and it even include a delicious breakfast buffet!I In general, I give this marriott an A+
reviews.title: We were robbed right out of the hotel "safe"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to share what happened at our Marriott stay so perhaps it will not be experienced by anyone else, my biggest advice is do NOT use the room “safes” they are anything but, we had several small problems on arrival which I was fine with first they said they had no room available for us right after saying they were expecting us but we could wait about 15 minutes and theyd get one no biggie trying to go with the flow, then she failed to actually activate one of our keys, again no big deal, there were several other small issues but they aren’t important to condense it money was stolen from our hotel safe, they promised to have police file a report etc waited for us to get back home and changed their whole story, we are out $200 but hopefully it will be valuable advice for someone else. To make this easier here’s my copied and pasted messages. I want to add I waited two nights for them to contact me intially and never heard a word, since my last message to them I have received NO reply. I am in the process of looking up the CEO, I alerted my coordinatoor as to what happened as well. I x'ed out our personal information to repost (only email addresse and last name)
reviews.title: Nice accomodations good location.

reviews.text: I stayed here because it came included with my surgery package, but I really liked it. The staff all spoke English well, and were friendly. There was even a younger man in the lobby working who helped give us some tips on where to go while there in Tijuana. My father enjoyed the restaurant, and we had drinks the night before my surgery. It was all really nice and I liked the style of the hotel. The rooms were nice, and my only wish was that there were more TV channels in English. However, it's of course expected that the cable be in Spanish while in Mexico lol. The business center was nice, and it helped me keep in touch with my fiance while I was away. The hotel even offers a cab service if you're worried about the regular cabs there. We had a nice view from our balcony of the hills. If I ever get to go back, I will be staying here again.
reviews.title: Lovely
Safe & Clean.
reviews.text: The best breakfast buffet in town. Clean and safe, good service.

reviews.title: much ado about nothing
reviews.text: the hotel is much ado about nothing. u will get a comfortable room whose carpet, floor, switch, wire, nut and bolt u will be charged for. some of those things dont work. breakfast was badly delayed till 11 am on one day. the hotel kindly agreed to pay for the breakfast but withheld the fruit juice ! the hotel charges 20% tax over the rate of 75$ making ur bill come to 89$ finally per day. if u can find another option then go for it.

We were a little jittery about traveling to Tijuana but made the trip anyway from Chicago. The cab driver charge us $18 from the airport to the Marriot, which the doorman told us was too much. The staff at the Marriot is extremely friendly and courteous. The room we stayed was clean and quiet. The pool is also kept impeccably clean. We travel a lot and have stayed at top hotels in Europe, Asia, and the Middle East. Marriot, Tijuana, is certainly at par with some of the best hotels in the world.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recentky stayed at the Marriott in TJ, a little worried due to all the bad press recently against TJ, but to my surprise was a wonderful trip!. The service was outstanding, they upgraded our room to one with a beautiful view. Sergio and the concierge were incredible , giving us tips about a great Argentinian rest, Cheripan, ans a great winery, De Cetto. We are coming back. by the way, we felt very safe, we rode cabs to everywhere, went to due some groceries shopping, to the mall. Great Stay! Free internet.
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in TJ

reviews.text: This hotel lives up to the Marriott name. I've never been disappointed with a Marriott, and I have stayed in Mexico plenty of times, so my expectations were pretty low. However, this hotel had all the fabulous amenities we've come to expect from a Marriott, including the awesome sheets and bedding, and it was immaculate. Oh, and the best part? It was only $79 per night! I would have paid at least $150 for that level of hotel in the states! I will definitely be returning to this hotel.
reviews.title: If your trip to Tijuana is overnight, stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hadn't been to TJ in YEARS and never away from the downtown area. The Marriott is somewhat of a hidden gem. A mere $7.00 US cab ride from the border, nice, clean room with a balcony and view of the golf course, nice pool area. As a Marriott Platinum Elite member I was given Exec Lounge access and choice of welcome ammenity upon arrival. Exec Lounge is so-so. Staff in Exec Lounge friendly but doesn't stay on top of things - food offerings a little dissapointing and they seemed to wait until things ran out to replenish rather than being pro-active, both at the cocktail hour and at breakfast. But the Exec Lounge is open 7 days a week unlike many US and Canadian Marriott properties which close at noon Friday to Sunday evening. Fitness center needs an overhaul, but did serve my needs. I'd definitely recommend this hotel for travelers to Tijuana.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, room and food are great, the problem was the service. not a Marriott style!|
reviews.title: nice hotel... but some problems!

reviews.text: When we arrived, at check-in, they didn't find our reservation and it seems like they haven't seen your reservation!!
reviews.title: Amazing!

likes.liked: — It was so clean and comfortable. 2 wonderful, firm,beds, with nice comforters.
likes.disliked: — Out of the way from shopping

reviews.text: it was friday evening and they said "we have a reservation only by tomorrow, tonight we are full booked!". Really, we changed our reservation by Marriott international and we had a copy of the new reservation.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.text: I am a frequent Marriott traveler and base my review on present and past experiences in both the states and internationally. With that said I have stayed at the following hotels in TJ: Camino Real, Grand Tijuana and Pueblo Amigo. The Marriott is by far the best in town and when I need to stay there I will always stay at this hotel
reviews.title: Best Hotel in TJ...but it does not have true Marriott standards !!!

likes.disliked: — The service was awful and not true Marriott.

reviews.text: However, it does not live up to the Marriott brand. The beds are true Marriott and the hotel and rooms are great, as is the food. The problem is with the service, they just dont seem to care and think they are doing you a favor for letting you stay there. At check-in it takes about 15 minutes, and thats with no one in front of you. There are plenty of clerks but they all seem to be busy . They do not acknowledge you as an elite member (nor upgrade you) and it seems like they haven't seen your reservation.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel 3 different times in the last 6 mo's and at every check in to the room I checked the safe and it did not work. The battery was dead and this past trip they tried to fix it but could not. I called the desk and asked for a different room with a safe and they said " I am so sorry. We will call you back in 5 minutes with a new room" Well, 20 minutes later no call or new room so I call back and they said the same thing. So ended up not getting what I paid for and stayed in that room.
reviews.title: Lounge is a Bust

reviews.text: Check out took another 15 minutes. No express etc.... They also don't keep their mini bar fully stocked and don't give you a inventory of whats inside. When I stayed in December they did not give me credit for my points and did not have a record of my stay. I mean this is not Marriott quality in the service department !! Otherwise it is a very fine hotel.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.text: The Tijuana Marriott is a great option, good location near the Caliente Casino/racetrack. The rooms are comfortable, recently remodeled with a clean, modern feel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Commitment to excellence at rookie hotel
